alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Macomb; Oakland; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 2:53AM EDT until August 24 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Livingston County in southeastern Michigan... Macomb County in southeastern Michigan... Oakland County in southeastern Michigan... Wayne County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 700 AM EDT. * At 253 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since 2 AM from western Wayne county through central Livingston county. Additional rainfall at 1 to 2 inches per hour is likely from 3 AM to 4 AM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Warren, Livonia, Troy, Southfield, Taylor, St. Clair Shores, Pontiac, Novi, Romulus, Mount Clemens, Hartland, New Baltimore, Fenton, Flat Rock, Howell, Brighton, Milford, Holly, Richmond and Grosse Pointe. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
